name: repugnantly
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
in a way that is very unpleasant and causes a feeling of disgust (= strong disapproval and dislike): A number of repugnantly sexist and racist tweets were exposed by the press. There was a repugnantly hostile atmosphere among the fans, and it felt as if violence could break out at any time.
More examplesFewer examplesThe system that was so repugnantly promoted in the country has finally been removed.In the story, he is a repugnantly ugly character but with a heart of gold.The country was ruled by a repugnantly vile dictator.
